results.firPara: When Evertons major shareholders concluded years of searching for a mega-rich owner by selling just under 50% of the club to Farhad Moshiri for £87.5m last February, it was widely assumed Moshiris senior business partner, the Uzbek-Russian billionaire Alisher Usmanov, must be looming large behind him.
results.secPara: Usmanov, though, has a 30% stake in Arsenal, the club he harbours an appetite to buy, but where he has been held at bay and arms length by the US investor Stan Kroenke, who owns 67% and is buttressed by the alliances of the board. Premier League rules prohibiting dual ownership, aimed at maintaining proper competition, forbid a person who owns more than 10% of one club to buy shares in another.
results.webTitle: The curious case of Farhad Moshiri, Alisher Usmanov and new money at Everton | David Conn

results.firPara: Ancient Athens was arguably run more successfully than the FA for quite a long time, so why doesnt the ruling body adopt a lot-drawing system for selecting council members – how could it possibly be worse?

results.firPara: Philippe Coutinho is close to extending his Liverpool career – and dashing Barcelonas hopes of a summer move for the Brazil international – by signing a new five-year contract with the Anfield club.
results.secPara: Liverpool have opened contract talks with Coutinho and his representative, Kia Joorabchian, as planned despite the 24-year-old being tied to the club until 2020. Liverpools owner, Fenway Sports Group, is aware of the Brazilians growing status in the game and keen to reward his outstanding form this season with extended and improved terms that will see the playmaker join the highest earners at the club.
results.webTitle: Philippe Coutinho close to extending Liverpool stay until 2022

results.firPara: The sums players are being offered by China are not normal, according to former Chelsea midfielder Michael Ballack, who urged Diego Costa and his ilk to keep their heads as the riches only increase

results.webTitle: Michael Ballack urges Diego Costa and co to beware Chinese riches

results.firPara: • Anfield manager says club have plenty to play for
results.secPara: Liverpool stand one game away from a Wembley final, most probably against Manchester United, and a chance to present Jürgen Klopp with the first silverware of his time in England. The German is excited by the prospect – I am full of energy, full of power – but already he can sense the rest of Merseyside lagging behind his level of electricity.
results.webTitle: Jurgen Klopp urges misfiring Liverpool to ‘be happy’ in trophy hunt

results.firPara: The holders are out after a pitiful display against a diligent Morocco side who won thanks to a wonderful strike from substitute Rachid Alioui
results.secPara: Well that was a poor game of football lit up by one moment of magic. Thanks for that Rachid Alioui. Morocco showed that they have the defensive nous to grind out the results needed to go deep into this competition. Herve Renard is working his wizardry once more. Thanks for your emails. Bye.
results.webTitle: Morocco 1-0 Ivory Coast: Afcon 2017 – as it happened

results.firPara: The Goodison Park old boys contingent in Sunderlands dressing room gained a new member on Tuesday when Joleon Lescott signed a short-term contract with David Moyess side and joined Steven Pienaar, Victor Anichebe and Jack Rodwell on Wearside.
results.secPara: A free agent following the decision by AEK Athens to terminate his contract in November, Lescott hopes that Moyes, his old manager at Everton, can help revive a career that foundered at Aston Villa last season. Sunderland trust the 34‑year‑old former England and Manchester City centre‑half – who can also operate at left‑back and has been training with them while on trial during recent days – will provide the Premier Leagues bottom side with some much-needed defensive nous and stability.
results.webTitle: Joleon Lescott reunites with David Moyes after signing for Sunderland

results.firPara: Crystal Palace were busy on Tuesday, agreeing personal terms with Patrick van Aanholt, trying to conclude a deal for Yann MVila and inviting Christopher Samba for a trial
